result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:32 AM Defendant Reginald Bernard Trussell not in court.  Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn in court for Reginald Bernard Trussell.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
22CM350 was scheduled for change of plea.
Deft has picked up a new file in case 22CM1188.
Parties are waiting on restitution figures to come back.
Defense indicates the deft is not feeling well and would ask for the warrant be stayed.
Defense is asking for a status date.
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited. - stayed until the next court date.
Status conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Notice of Intent to introduce certified records of regularly conducted activity w/o extrinsic evidence
State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's statements

records.addlTxt: Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with Walmart stores. (person, property, residence or family).

1:52 PM Defendant Reginald Bernard Trussell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Reginald Bernard Trussell.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, not guilty plea entered, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
